const isPrime = (n) => {
  if (n < 2) return false
  if (n === 2) return true
  if (n === 3) return true
  if (n === 1 || n === 4) return false
  if (n % 2 === 0) return false
  if (n % 3 === 0) return false
  if (n % 5 === 0) return false
  if (n % 7 === 0) return false
  if (n % 11 === 0) return false
  if (n % 13 === 0) return false
  if (n % 17 === 0) return false

  for (let i = 6; i <= sqrt; i += 6) {
    if (n % i === 0) return false
  }
  return true
}

  */
const primes = (n) => {
  const i = 2
  const arr = []
  while (i < n) {
    if (isPrime(i)) arr.push(i)
    i += 1
  }
  return arr
}

const primeFactors = (num) => {
  const primeFactor = (num) => {
    if (num < 2) return num
    if (num % 2 === 0) return 2
    const primes = []
    for (let i = 3; i <= num / 2; i += 2) {
      if (num % i === 0) {

        while (num % i === 0) {

      primes.push(num)
    }
    return primes
  }

}
